instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD Touch ID Sensor
threads.message: Hi, i got a 2017 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> machine that i swapped the motherboard because the original died, however the new motherboard didnt come with the touch id sensor, now of course the touch id doesnt work. Is there any way to make it compatible with the new board? i tried a clean me BIOS but it didnt work

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD Touch ID Sensor
threads.message: I also still have the old board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD Touch ID Sensor
threads.message: An Apple official service can do that.
